my favourite app to edit my video content . saved me money.

wow fantistic app olive

I dont hate it but since i cant even put a picture in the time line (not talk about a video) i can only give a star :( really hoping to change this rating in the future.

I was looking for a video app, that easly chroma erase as how my jobs required, fast, free, and best quality.

i tried the 0.2 version on windows and linux but its crashes a lot , issue in rendering file , i become not responsive all of sudden. i think the older version is much better. hoping to get a official release soon with is very sable.

I introduced this app to my daughters who needed to edit videos for university and high school. It worked so well for them I stared to donate to the project. The olive team is doing amazing work and i think soon we will have a true competitor to premier and final cut on Linux.
summary: One of the best video editors on linux

description: everything else about it is great. I just wish it wouldn't crash every 10 minutes
Hope there's new update... I think it's better if I can just donwload the needed features, because it will not take to much ram :>

Not only does this app not work; it's such a hungry-hungry-hippo when it comes to RAM and CPU usage that it will render your entire computer completely useless for a few moments before you're able to successfully rage quit.

Had zero success and I've melted my house down.
summary: Curiously designed to set fire to a computer

description: And made it difficult regardless!

Simple and really lightweight! With a couple of small changes in code is working perfectly with the NVidia encoder. The community Effects is a must have! 

I had no luck with version 0.2

I initially installed Olive using the Ubuntu repository. The video playback was always just black (audio played ok). I decided to de-install it and used the FlatHub repo instead. It's working perfectly from what I can tell. 

I'm running Linux Lite 5.8 on an old HP Pressario tower with only 2GB of RAM. It will be a challenge to see if I can actually edit video with this ancient beast.
Could not insert video
summary: Did not see an option to select a video for editing

description: This is hard to figure out.

Olive 0.1 or whatever is a legitimately good app (great for those who can't afford Adobe Premiere), if a little flaky.

But instead of fixing the moderate bugs, the developer decided to overhaul the interface- thus resulting in a program that is both buggy and tricky to use. An update that returns to former glory "aka the Last Crusade version" would be welcome.
summary: Olive 1 is a good Premiere knock off-2 is.

description: It behaves like Resolve, Premiere, Avid MC and FCP 7. I could start editing right away. Too bad it crashed less than a minute after I started using it.
Looks great, but I can't run it more than a couple of minutes without crashing.
summary: Looks great, but only runs a couple of minutes before crashing

description: Love it. It works perfectly in my ubuntu 22.04

The common thread is that ON means ON and OFF means OFF - take the common domestic light switch - everyone "gets it" and the design is pretty much universal.

I can't work with this design - the layout - the configurations - the settings.....

To me it's not intuitive, the parts and the parts in combination, make no sense.

And the simple act of "Import" ==> "Edit" ==> "Export" -- It's beyond me.

I should not need a deep and meaningful understanding of obscure and disconnected meanings and functions....

For instance I imported a video and it was turned sidewards.

For starters no other program has ever imported the video, and rotated it 90*, AND there was no way to correct it.

I am a little tired of cleverness beyond redemption.

OpenShot was my favourite, until it started to become unstable of late...

I might go back to an earlier version.
summary: See different people see things in different ways

description: Very difficult to use and overwhelms you with a list of menus and settings. Probably would be better for avanced users.

its very cool, its a premiere pro basics for edit your video
for linux, its the best or me now !
Olive is useful but this version was buggy on my machine. Get Olive from its website instead.

its easy, simple to use and clean interface... especially for beginners and quick daily edits along with basic motion graphics....!!
Not much for advance editors ... BUT I have hopes !!
THE BEST PART its "LITE" and works fast with high resolution video (above HD) !!
Schade bleibt nach dem Laden und dem Versuch den mp4 ab zu spielen hängen.
Läuft stabl auf Raspberry Pi 400 mit Manjaro ARM
Garbage made by clearly mentally ill people
MUY LIVIANO FACIL DE ENTENDER Y LISTO PARA TRABAJAR... EL ÚNICO PROBLEMA ES Q AUN ESTA JOVEN Y NO TRAE ALGO Q ES INDISPENSABLE PARA TRABAJAR EN VIDEO ... PROXIS

se parece mucho a adobe premiere y un poco a final cut, es sencillo y es mas rapido y funcional, tiene efectos que podemos encontrar en sony vegas y premiere, es sencillo de usar y lo mejor de todo es gratis!

Despues de una experiencia muy fallida con el nuevo OpenShot, descubrí este mirando por la Tienda de Aplicaciones.
En verdad que es un maravilla. Todavía le faltan cosas, pero para ser una Alfa, tiene muy muy buena pinta.
Lo recomiendo totalmente.

Hasta el momento es el editor de video con que he tenido la mejor experiencia en gnu/linux. Es solo una versión alpha y es muy potente y estable. Me gusta su interfaz, más ordenada que otros programas. Promete bastante.

Utilizo la versión en formato Flatpak, funciona muy bien.

Quizas le falte mas efectos.
 Seria bueno que a los nombres de los repositorios les añadieran si son editores de video etc. Porque Olive a secas si hace tiempo no lo usas no te acuerdas para que sirve. Muchas gracias por ayudarnos.
era mas estable la version anterior, esta version se cierra sola cuando no sabe como procesar algo
Me parece muy buen desarrollo, con herramientas muy profesionales. Espero la versión terminada con ansia. En linux nos hace falta este tipo de software urgente.
summary: La versión 2 no esta terminada pero promete muchisimo

description: Todo bien con el programa, tiene todo lo necesario que se necesita para un editor de video simple. Ya lo desinstale y lo volví a instalar, pero el problema aun persiste.

объясню коротко и ясно. шустро работает, не заметил лагов при монтаже когда овер дофига дорожек и эффектов. раньше юзал kdenlive 4 дорожки и пару эффектов работать было ну очень тяжело из-за лагов.
